justification: Team B is 0-8, prefers reliable floors and possession WRs; trading away Caleb Foster (steady Tier 2 possession WR) for Kyle Taylor (Tier 4, high-variance rookie) conflicts with B’s stated values and urgent need for stability. The pitch frames upside and playoff schedule—misaligned with B’s immediate win-now priority—so acceptance is overestimated. The offer is structurally feasible and suits Team A’s goals, but the rationale is thin and not grounded in B’s motives.
